Las unidades solo pueden
ser de tres colores:
    Azul (Jugador)
    Rojo (Enemigas)
    Verde (Neutrales)
Las unidades azules son del
jugador. Las unidades rojas son
enemigos que debes derrotar.
Las unidades rojas atacan a
las azules y a las verdes.
[060E]
Las unidades se mueven
por turnos en este orden:
    1. Jugador (azul)
    2. Enemigo (rojo)
    3. Neutral (verde)
[060F]
Si los PV de un personaje
principal llegan a cero,
la partida terminará.
[0610]
El área azul que aparece cuando
seleccionas a una unidad es su
área de desplazamiento. Puedes
ver también el de las unidades
enemigas si las seleccionas o
presionas SELECT.
[0611]
Las unidades con montura
pueden moverse después
de visitar pueblos o casas
si no han agotado sus
casillas de movimiento.
[0612]
El área roja que aparece
cuando seleccionas una unidad
es el alcance de su ataque.
También puedes ver el alcance
del ataque de tus enemigos.
[0613]
Cada tipo de arma tiene sus
ventajas y sus inconvenientes.
Las espadas son eficaces
contra las hachas. Las hachas
son eficaces contra las lanzas
y las lanzas son eficaces
contra las espadas.
Este es el triángulo
de las armas.
[0614]
Las clases que usan magia,
como los magos y clérigas,
aprenderán nuevas magias
al llegar a ciertos niveles.
Las magias que hacen daño
se les llama magia negra,
y las magias que curan o
causan otros efectos se
les llama magia blanca.
La magia es una poderosa
herramienta en las batallas,
pero usualmente se necesita
gastar PV para usarla.
La resistencia de una unidad
puede reducir el daño de
las magias enemigas.
Además, la clase
Ajusticiador puede reducir
a la mitad ataques mágicos,
haciéndolos útiles para
enfrentar a magos fuertes.
[0615]
Algunas armas son muy eficaces
contra ciertas unidades y les
causan graves daños. Los
arcos, por ejemplo, son muy
eficaces contra las unidades
aéreas. Si una unidad con un
arma especialmente poderosa
contra la unidad enemiga
se enfrenta a ella, el ícono
del arma brillará en el recuadro
de información de combate.
[0616]
Los golpes críticos hacen
el triple de daño.
Las posibilidades de dar
un golpe crítico dependen de
las características de tu
unidad y del arma que utilice.

[0617]
Se considera daño físico el
provocado por un arma. La
Def. (defensa) de cada unidad
indica las posibilidades que
tiene de absorber daño físico.
Cuanto mayor sea el indicador de
Def., menos daño físico recibirá
la unidad. Los caballeros, los
acorazados y los mecenarios
tienen buena Def.
[0618]
Algunas clases tienen
habilidades extras conectadas
al movimiento que pueden
usar cerca de otras unidades.
Hay cuatro de estas
habilidades:
1. Empujar
(Permite empujar a un aliado
hacia otra casilla)
2. Choque
(Permite empujar a un aliado
hacia dos casillas)
3. Trocar
(La unidad intercambia lugar
con un aliado adyacente)
4. Pasar
(La unidad pasa al lado
opuesto de un aliado adyacente)
Empujar y Choque pueden usarse
en unidades verdes y rojas,
solo si la constitución del
usuario es mayor que la del
objetivo. Algunas unidades,
como los jefes, no pueden ser
empujadas.
[0619]
Restaura los PV de una unidad
con pociones y magia blanca.
Las pociones y los elixires
curan solo a la unidad que los
usa, mientras que la magia
blanca usa PV del usuario
para curar a un objetivo.
Elige tus métodos de
curación cuidadosamente.
[061A]
Hay cuatro alteraciones posibles
del estado de una unidad:
1. Congelada
(Paralizada y no se mueve)
2. Silenciada
(No puede usar hablar o magia)
3. Envenenada
(Pierde PV con el tiempo)
4. Petrificada
(No se puede mover o esquivar)
Estos estados duran varios
turnos. Se curan con una
magia de restauración.
[061B]
Esta es la información que
aparece en el recuadro de
información estratégica de
combate:

PV: Puntos de vida restantes.
Po.: Cantidad de daño infligido
por el arma.
Gol.: Posibilidades de golpear.
Crí: Posibilidades de asestar
un golpe crítico.
[061C]
Esta es la información que
aparece en el recuadro de
información detallada de
combate:

PV: Puntos de vida restantes.
Ata.: Cantidad de daño infligido
en el ataque.
Def.: Cantidad de daño que se
resta al ataque enemigo.
Gol.: Posibilidades de golpear.
Crí: Posibilidades de asestar
un golpe crítico.
VA: Velocidad del ataque de
cada unidad. Determina el
número de golpes por ataque.
[061D]
Cualquier unidad puede rescatar
a otra unidad azul o verde en un
espacio contiguo siempre que
la constitución (Cons.) de la
unidad rescatada sea menor que
el indicador de ayuda (Ayud.)
de la unidad que se rescata.
Una unidad que haya rescatado
a otra sufre penalizaciones a la
habilidad (Hab.) y a la velocidad
(Vel.) mientras cargue con la
unidad rescatada. La opción de
rescatar es útil para salvar
unidades a punto de morir.
[061E]
Puedes soltar una unidad
rescatada en cualquier espacio
contiguo. La unidad que acabas
de soltar no se moverá hasta el
siguiente turno.
[061F]
Puedes comprar objetos en
las tiendas. También te los
encontrarás en pueblos, casas
y cofres. Algunos enemigos dejan
objetos al ser derrotados.
[0620]
Escoge un objeto de la lista y
pulsa el Botón A para usarlo.
Los objetos que no puedas
usar aparecerán en color gris.
[0621]
Puedes intercambiar objetos
entre unidades adyacentes.
Elige [OpenQuote]Intercambiar[CloseQuote] en el menú
y después elige la unidad con
la que quieras intercambiar
objetos. Coloca el cursor sobre
el objeto que quieras y pulsa el
Botón A para tomarlo o cambiarlo
por otro.
[0622]
Algunos objetos tienen un
número limitado de usos.
El número que aparece al lado
del icono indica el número
de usos que le quedan antes
de desaparecer.
Procura que no se te rompan
objetos importantes en medio
de una batalla.
[0623]
El personaje principal lleva
el carro en el que se guardan
los objetos que no están
equipados. Durante la
preparación de la batalla puedes
incluso comprar y vender
objetos en el carro. En él,
caben hasta 200 objetos.
En la dificultad Normal o
Difícil, los grupos de Alm
y Celica tendrán cada uno
mitades separadas.
[0624]
Coloca una unidad en la
armería para comprar armas.
En las armerías también puedes
vender objetos.
[0625]
Sitúa una unidad sobre una
tienda y selecciona [OpenQuote]tienda[CloseQuote]
para comprar y vender pociones,
llaves, y otros objetos.
[0626]
Cuando una unidad ataca a
otra que se encuentre sobre
bosque o montaña, el
porcentaje de acierto de golpe
se reduce. Si vas a detenerte
en el área de alcance de ataque
de una unidad enemiga, procura
situarte sobre bosque o
montaña. Sin embargo, la magia
no es afectada por el terreno.
[0627]
Cualquier unidad que se
detenga sobre un fuerte,
una puerta de castillo, una
puerta o un trono recuperará
PV al principio de su turno
automáticamente.
Además, anillos especiales
pueden ser equipados para
restaurar PV siempre, y pueden
combinarse con la recuperación
de ese tipo de terrenos.
[0628]
Sitúa una unidad sobre una
casa para poder visitarla.
Visitar casas es una
buena forma de conseguir
información valiosa.
Visítalas siempre que puedas.
[0629]
Sitúa una unidad sobre un
pueblo para poder visitarlo.
Visitar pueblos es una
buena forma de conseguir
información, objetos valiosos
e incluso dinero.
Visítalos siempre que puedas.
[062A]
Sitúa unidades sobre cofres
para abrirlos. En los cofres
suele haber objetos valiosos,
pero necesitarás ganzúas
o llaves de cofre para abrirlos.
[062B]
Si ves un tronco viejo cerca
de un río, derríbalo para crear
un puente improvisado.
[062C]
Golpea los muros con grietas
para derribarlos y poder pasar.
[062D]
La oscuridad y la niebla reducen
tu campo de visión y te impiden
ver enemigos alejados.
Usa ladrones, antorchas o
magia blanca para
ver de lejos.
[062E]
Las máquinas de asedio
disparan proyectiles desde
largas distancias. Sitúa un
arquero o un tirador sobre
una de ellas para usarla.
[062F]
En tu misión te cruzarás con
muchos personajes que se
pueden unir a tu causa.
Fíjate bien en la historia y
los diálogos y adivina quién
los podría convencer para que
se unan a tu grupo.
[0630]
Excepto en raras ocasiones, si
una unidad pierde todos sus
PV, se retira de la batalla y
no podrá luchar de nuevo.
¡Ten cuidado!En el modo Casual,
las unidades caídas volverán
en el siguiente capítulo.
[0631]
Algunas unidades tienen
un vínculo especial que las
une. Cuanto más tiempo
pasen cerca, más fuerte se
volverá este vínculo. En cuanto
el vínculo sea lo suficientemente
fuerte, aparecerá la opción de
[OpenQuote]apoyo[CloseQuote] en el menú y las
unidades podrán mantener una
conversación de apoyo.
[0632]
Si las unidades compatibles
entre sí se encuentran a un
máximo de 3 cuadrados de
distancia, obtendrán
bonificaciones en el combate.
Hay tres niveles de apoyo y
cuanto mayor sea el nivel,
mayores serán las
bonificaciones recibidas.
El nivel de apoyo aumenta
cada vez que las unidades
mantienen una conversación.
[0633]
Las unidades verdes son
neutras. Se pueden aliar
contigo si hablas con ellas.
Si sitúas una unidad en un
espacio contiguo, aparecerá
la opción [OpenQuote]hablar[CloseQuote] en el menú.
Selecciona [OpenQuote]hablar[CloseQuote] para
convencer a la unidad.
[0634]
Algunas unidades enemigas
pueden aliarse contigo si
hablas con ellas. Sitúa una
unidad tuya cerca de la unidad
enemiga que quieras convencer
para ver si pueden hablar.
¡Ten cuidado! ¡La unidad
te atacará hasta que hables
con ella! Procura hablar con
ella antes de eliminarla o
que te elimine.
[0635]
Si derrotas al jefe enemigo,
completarás el mapa. No es
necesario eliminar al resto de
unidades.
[0636]
Sitúa el personaje principal
en el trono, la puerta del
castillo o la puerta que debas
tomar y selecciona la opción
[OpenQuote]tomar[CloseQuote] para completar
el mapa.
[0637]
Completa el mapa eliminando
a todos los enemigos.
[0638]
Aguanta los ataques enemigos
un número de turnos
establecido.
[0639]
Selecciona [OpenQuote]interrumpir[CloseQuote] en el
menú para guardar la partida
durante el combate. La próxima
vez que juegues selecciona
[OpenQuote]reanundar capítulo[CloseQuote] para
seguir con el combate
donde lo dejaste.
[063A]
Elige [OpenQuote]guardar[CloseQuote] en el mapa
del continente para guardar
la partida entre dos capítulos.
[063B]
Sitúa el cursor en un punto del
mapa y pulsa el botón A para
desplazarte hasta ese lugar.
[063C]
En algunos lugares del mapa
del continente hay tiendas.
Puedes ver si una base tiene
tienda situando el cursor sobre
ella y observando los íconos
que aparecen al lado del nombre
de la base. Puedes acceder a
la tienda si el personaje
principal se encuentra
sobre esa base.
[063D]
Administra los objetos de tus
unidades situando el cursor
sobre el personaje principal
y pulsando el botón A.
[063E]
En el mapa del continente
aparecerán enemigos en
áreas por las que ya has
pasado. Para eliminarlos,
desplázate hasta el lugar
en el que se encuentren y
lucha contra ellos.
[063F]
Prepara tus unidades para
la batalla antes de comenzar.
Elige las unidades que van a
luchar y selecciona sus armas
y objetos. Cuando hayas
terminado, pulsa START.
[0640]
Las unidades adquieren EXP
(puntos de experiencia)
luchando y usando magia.
Aumentan un nivel al llegar a
los 100 EXP. Cuando el nivel
de una unidad aumenta, sus
características mejoran.
El nivel más alto que puede
alcanzar una unidad es 20.
Y dependiendo de qué clase
sea, más tardará en subir
de nivel.
[0641]
La mayoría de las unidades
puede cambiar de clase al
llegar a cierto nivel.
Este nivel varía dependiendo
de la clase, pero se puede
saber cuando se puede cambiar
de clase si aparece un ícono
de una estatua de Mila en
el menú de las unidades.
Al estar al lado de una
Estatua de Mila en combate,
la opción [OpenQuote]Mila[CloseQuote]
aparecerá en el menú,
selecciona la opción [OpenQuote]Mila[CloseQuote]
para cambiar de clase.
Cambiar de clase hará
que las estadísticas de
la unidad suban hasta las
bases de su próxima clase.
Los aldeanos pueden elegir
entre 5 clases para cambiar,
pero esas y otras clases
tienen un orden evolutivo.
Deberías de considerar
cómo armar a tu equipo
al elegir una rama de clase.
[0642]
Si no estás seguro de saber
para qué sirve una opción,
sitúa el cursor sobre ella y
pulsa el Botón R: podrás ver
una explicación corta de la
opción.
[0643]
Después de cierto punto en la
historia, podrás controlar
a Alm y Celica juntos en el
mapa del contiente.
Para cambiar el personaje
principal que está moviendo,
mueve el cursor a una zona
vacía y selecciona [OpenQuote]Cambiar[CloseQuote]
en el menú del mapa.
Los grupos de Alm y Celica
tendrán diferente carro,
pero si estás jugando en Fácil,
ellos podrán compartir objetos.
[0644]
Puedes abandonar batallas
en santuarios, cuevas y
otros lugares que ya hayas
completado. En el menú,
selecciona [OpenQuote]Retirada[CloseQuote] para
abandonar el combate en
cualquiera de estos
casos.

[07D5]
Alm, Hero-King
[07D6]
As the first king of the One Kingdom of
Valentia, Alm spent his life restoring the
continent to glory. He would be remembered
by later generations as Saint-King Alm I,
who cast off the gods' oppressive yoke.
[07D7]
Busy days awaited Alm and Celica as they
built the One Kingdom anew. Alm's strong
conviction cemented the nation's roots, and
with Celica's wise rule and calm demeanor,
their legacy lasted a thousand years.
[07D8]
Celica, Mila's Legacy
[07D9]
As was her birthright, Celica became the
first queen of the One Kingdom of Valentia,
and ruled it with wisdom and compassion.
Believed by the people to be a reincarnation
of Mila, she was venerated as a living saint.
[07DA]
Mycen, Caballero Supremo
[07DB]
Como nuevo canciller de Gran Valentia, y
mano derecha de Alm, sir Mycen se devivió
por devolver el esplendor al continente.
A pesar de su nueva posición, Alm y Celica
siguieron amándolo como su abuelo.
[07DC]
Nomah, Jolly and Wise
[07DD]
After spearheading the unification of the
Mila and Duma Faithful, Nomah became the
new sect's high priest. Despite his busy
schedule, his friends attest that he retained
his playful, easygoing nature all his life.
[07DE]
Lukas, Sharp Soldier
[07DF]
Lukas joined the Brotherhood of Knights, and,
after retiring, founded a school where he
devoted himself to his students' education.
His calm demeanor won him many friends, and
he never once longed for companionship again.
[07E0]
Kliff, Young Genius
[07E1]
With the war over, Kliff bid Alm farewell
and vanished--with some speculating that he
left for a new continent. Decades later,
a young mage prodigy claiming to be Kliff's
son arrived in Valentia to serve the king.
[07E2]
Tobin, Right-hand Man
[07E3]
As one of the most scrupulous knights in the
One Kingdom's Brotherhood, Tobin spent his
life serving his friend King Alm. In turn,
Alm placed a great deal of trust in Tobin,
eventually granting him a landed title.
[07E4]
Unable to move past Gray's death, Tobin
abruptly vanished before reappearing just as
suddenly several years later. While King Alm
welcomed him into the Knights, the talkative,
playful Tobin of old was gone forever.
[07E5]
Tobin put his earnings from his service in the
army towards sending his younger siblings to
a prestigious school in the capital. He and
Faye settled down in Ram Village anew, with
an abundance of tales to tell to their sons.
[07E6]
Gray, Wry Comrade
[07E7]
As a member of the One Kingdom's Brotherhood
of Knights, Gray worked diligently at restoring
the continent. Later in life he wrote an
acclaimed memoir, [OpenQuote]The Tale of Gray (Plus
That One Guy): My Youth with King Alm I[CloseQuote].
[07E8]
Having lost the woman he loved, Gray surprised
even himself by embracing the life of a
vagabond and setting off for parts unknown.
His friends spared no effort in attempting
to track him down, but it was to no avail.
[07E9]
Devastated by Tobin's death, Gray was nearly
lost to the demon drink until his fiancée
convinced him to clean up. He settled into
a sober and quiet life with his wife and son,
whom he named after his late friend.
[07EA]
In time, Gray's tenacity won Clair over, and
not long after came a child. As he was heard to
say, [OpenQuote]It's not the face that matters, but the
heart![CloseQuote] Meanwhile, Clair never stayed grounded,
setting trends in the world of pegasus racing.
[07EB]
Faye, Devoted Heart
[07EC]
Faye returned to her old life in Ram Village,
helping her parents with the textile business
until she and her husband inherited it.
Despite missing her old friends, she never
again felt the urge to leave her hometown.
[07ED]
Clair, Highborn Flier
[07EE]
Clair continued to work hard as a knight on
behalf of the continent. She later wed a man
worthy of her high standards and became a
mother, but she never stayed grounded--she &
her pegasus continued to race across the sky.
[07EF]
Gray's death left Clair feeling betrayed and
alone, but she joined the knights of the One
Kingdom and contributed greatly to their growth.
The people were enamored with her melancholy
beauty and combat prowess alike.
[07F0]
Clive, Humble Noble
[07F1]
Clive was appointed the first captain of the
One Kingdom's Brotherhood of Knights. His
talent and honesty made him popular with
commoners and nobles alike, and under his and
his wife's leadership, the knights flourished.
[07F2]
Clive and Mathilda were wed, and she gratefully
retired from the public eye, allowing Clive
to take her position as captain. The knights
flourished under his leadership, but friends of
the pair knew Mathilda to be the true reason.
[07F3]
With his heart still heavy from the loss of
Mathilda, Clive was appointed captain of the
One Kingdom's Knights. He was soon killed in a
skirmish with pirates, and the people grieved
deeply over the young loss of so fine a knight.
[07F4]
Forsyth, Loyal Lieutenant
[07F5]
Forsyth joined the One Kingdom's knights after
the war, working hard to rebuild the nation.
Time took off some of his more caustic edges,
and he served many years alongside Clive
as a poised and thoughtful lieutenant.
[07F6]
Forsyth lived his life for the One Kingdom's
knights, as the late Clive would have wanted.
Time took off some of his more caustic edges,
leaving a poised and thoughtful demeanor
that reminded many of his old commander.
[07F7]
Forsyth joined the One Kingdom's knights after
the war. The loss of Python left him empty,
which is perhaps why he volunteered to go to
the borderlands to bring the king's peace.
He never returned to the capital.
[07F8]
Python, Apathetic Archer
[07F9]
While the One Kingdom offered him knighthood,
Python chose a quieter life as head of a
militia that defended villages from brigands.
His old friend would visit now and then, and
they'd pass the night with a bottle of wine.
[07FA]
Python was knighted into a new man who worked
diligently--almost as if possessed by Forsyth.
 Sadly, he died a few short years later while
fighting to suppress a rebellion, his wounds
claiming him while he was far too young.
[07FB]
Mae, Bundle of Energy
[07FC]
Mae returned to Novis and resumed her work at
the priory with Boey. She spent her days
helping others tirelessly, where she was
beloved for her kindness and wicked humor.
[07FD]
Mae and Boey returned to the priory to resume
their old lives--which quickly blossomed into
equal parts bickering and romance. Children
came soon, giving them cause to argue anew,
but both remarked they couldn't be happier.
[07FE]
After the loss of her verbal sparring partner,
Mae fell into a deep depression. With the
support of her friends, the light slowly
returned to her life, and she used her humor
and kindness to help others at the priory.
[07FF]
Silque, Wise Pilgrim
[0800]
The war left Valentia with many wounded, and
Silque traveled to the former Rigel to heal
all that she could. Her exact path could be
roughly retraced by following the far-flung
anecdotes of the countless lives she saved.
[0801]
Silque and Acantha traveled together across
the continent, helping the wounded of war.
Even after their work was done and they had
built a home together, they never lost their
love for adventure and for each other.
[0802]
Genny, Gentle Quill
[0803]
Shortly after publishing her first novel,
Genny wed a man no one would ever expect.
As for whom this was, none can say;
whenever she was asked, Genny replied
only with an enigmatic smile.
[0804]
Boey, Skillful Survivor
[0805]
Boey returned to Novis and resumed his work
at the priory with Mae. He spent his life
aiding the poor in humble, yet rewarding,
service, ultimately succeeding Nomah as
high priest of the priory.
[0806]
Only after losing Mae did Boey realize the
nature and intensity of his feelings for her.
Wracked with regret, he poured himself into
service for the poor at the priory, ultimately
succeeding Nomah as high priest.
[0807]
Conrad, Gentle Soul
[0808]
Post-war, Conrad put down his lance and took
up a quill, beginning a long career as a
civil servant. Following Mycen's retirement,
he became chancellor. Despite an endless chain
of suitors, he remained single all his life.
[0809]
Kamui, Wandering Blade
[080A]
Kamui assisted the establishment of a land
of, and for, mercenaries in the desert. He
lived there happily for a time, but in the
end, his wanderlust prevailed. One day he
went for a stroll and was never seen again.
[080B]
Kamui established a new kingdom of, and for,
mercenaries in Grieth's former territory.
He often aided Valentia's queen in times of
need, which steadily earned him fame and
respect as [OpenQuote]the Steel Amidst the Sand.[CloseQuote]
[080C]
Leon, True of Heart
[080D]
Welcomed into the Brotherhood of Knights,
Leon remained at Valbar's side until an
injury ended his fighting career. He took up
work as a city merchant, where he lived free,
happy and true to himself to the last.
[080E]
Leon took Atlas up on his offer to visit the
mountain. The fresh air and clean water did
wonders for his skin, and, to Atlas's delight,
he made his stay a permanent one. Their hunts
together kept their whole family well-fed.
[080F]
Dealt a grievous blow by Valbar's death, Leon
disappeared for a time before returning to
join the One Kingdom's Brotherhood of Knights.
He fought with the strength of a hundred men,
later serving as instructor to new recruits.
[0810]
Valbar, Ardent Knight
[0811]
Valbar joined the Brotherhood of Knights
at Alm's request as an instructor of new
recruits. Well-loved for his open and
honest nature, he spent his years happily
surrounded by friends and admirers.
[0812]
Mathilda, Paragon Knight
[0813]
Mathilda continued to serve the knighthood
for several years before taking a well-earned
early retirement. She was rarely seen in public
after that, but tales of her legendary exploits
lived on forever in Valentian history.
[0814]
Clive's death forced Mathilda to carry on in
his place as captain of the One Kingdom's
Knights, and she became a key figure in
the kingdom's growth. Her legendary exploits
lived on forever in Valentian history.
[0815]
Atlas, Mountain Man
[0816]
Atlas resumed life as a lumberjack at home
with his brothers, where their peaceful life
was safe from bandit attacks under his care.
While retired from the army, he was always
first to aid the queen in times of need.
[0817]
Crushed by the loss of his younger brother,
Atlas returned to the mountains to live a
quiet life as a lumberjack with his surviving
family. He fiercely defended his village from
bandits, and never again left the mountain.
[0818]
Hyas, Mountain Boy
[0819]
Hyas set out on a journey to the four corners
of the continent, making it his mission to try
every local delicacy Valentia had to offer.
In time, he realized his favorite dish of all
was still Ma's cooking, and returned home.
[081A]
Losing his eldest brother killed Hyas's dream
of exploring the wider world. Reluctantly, he
returned home to take up his brother's axe and
carry on his legacy as a lumberjack. In time,
this work began to balm the scar of his grief.
[081B]
Jesse, Steel of the Sand
[081C]
Jesse founded, and proved successful at ruling,
a mercenary kingdom in Grieth's former land.
He became a dependable ally to Valentia in
times of strife. Even now, tales of his valor
eulogize him as [OpenQuote]the Steel Amidst the Sand.[CloseQuote]
[081D]
Sonya, Bewitching Beauty
[081E]
Sonya's search for a cure for witches led her
across the land, but her trail soon vanished.
Shortly after, a small cloister of witches
took up residence in Nuibaba's former abode,
leading secluded, but honest, lives there.
[081F]
Deen, Silent Sword
[0820]
Shortly after the war, Deen vanished without
a trace, along with the Ruby Sword. No record
exists of his whereabouts thereafter.
[0821]
Saber, Sword and Shield
[0822]
Saber assisted Jesse in laying the foundation
for a new kingdom of, and for, mercenaries.
He continued working as a sellsword for many
years and aided the One Kingdom time and again,
always with his stunning bride by his side.
[0823]
Along with his stunning bride, Saber toiled
to rebuild Valentia. Though he never formally
enlisted as a knight, he put his skills and
experience to work mediating local struggles--
either with a fist of steel or a pint of ale.
[0824]
Saber and Sonya returned to the former Rigel
after a lavish wedding, and both toiled to
soothe the scars of their homeland--Sonya by
her tireless research on a cure for witches,
and Saber by mediating local disputes.
[0825]
Acantha, Cheery Thief
[0826]
Cautionary tales of the [OpenQuote]Siren of the Die[CloseQuote],
an honorific later pluralized when Acantha
took a wife, continued to spread through the
former Zofia's network of taverns for decades.
The treasure they buried has never been found.
[0827]
Luthier, Forest Sage
[0828]
Painfully aware of the inadequacy of his
magic, Luthier journeyed across the sea. What
he did there is unclear, but stories tell of a
steady stream of angry ruffians with a bone to
pick with a certain eccentric mage...
[0829]
Delthea, Mage Prodigy
[082A]
After the war, Delthea decided to lock away
her magic and pursue a wild and happy life
as an ordinary woman. She made a point to
return to her village often, where she would
liven things up with tales of her brother.
[082B]
Tatiana, Generous Saint
[082C]
Tatiana prayed that Zeke's memory would
remain hazy, and eventually the two would live
some semblance of a happy life. Though they
were parted at times, Zeke always returned
to Tatiana's side in the end.
[082D]
Her true love lost, Tatiana holed up in her
priory and devoted herself to prayer. An old
friend of hers made it a point to support her
through her grief, and from the ashes Zeke's
death had left of her heart, new love arose.
[082E]
Palla, Eldest Whitewing
[082F]
Having rescued Est as planned, Palla returned
home in triumph. Tales of her further exploits
line the pages of Archanea's history books.
[0830]
Though painful loss hung over her return home
like a dark cloud, the annals of Archanean
history are replete with tales of Palla's
glorious exploits later in life.
[0831]

Zeke, Caballero Ópalo
[0838]
Los fuegos de la guerra despertaron los
oscuros recovecos en la memoria de Zeke.
Pero su amor por Tatiana le llevó a
ocultarle su terrible pasado. Aunque él
siguió sufriendo en silencio, ambos
vivieron juntos felizmente.
[0839]
La pérdida de Tatiana, la mujer que lo amó
incondicionalmente, sumió a Ezekiel en la
desesperación y, tras la guerra, desapareció.
Hay quienes dicen haberlo visto en Akaneia,
pero no se sabe nada con certeza.
[083A]
Sus recuerdos volvieron, y los asuntos que
dejó pendientes fastidiaron la mente de Zeke.
Se fue a otra tierra, prometiéndole a Tatiana
que volvería sin importar qué. Los dos vivieron
una vida feliz una vez que reunieron.
